posts.post_content: As far as I know, the Revised Edition version of this is the only Magic card ever printed where it says that a creature is "killed," as opposed to a proper game term like "destroyed" or "buried."

Posted By: supershawn (5/24/2011 1:04:10 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Another old card created with ***flavour*** in mind... delicious, delicious flavour!
  
   
The oracle text is pretty wordy, to make the ability do what it is meant to do without allowing people to "abuse" it. I think it's a nice touch that it can taunt any creature without defender into attacking (and in this day and age, even some creatures WITH defender), but walls remain immune to its nettling insults. NOTE: [Mistform Ultimus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mistform Ultimus) gets off lucky. If they were ever going to reprint this card, it'd be great if they could use flavour text to allude to the REASON that a creature that cannot attack ends up being destroyed.
  
   
Also, another old card that has wings in the art but does not have flying - somewhat counterintuitive. Still very cool, regardless!
posts.html:
Another old card created with flavour in mind... delicious, delicious flavour!

The oracle text is pretty wordy, to make the ability do what it is meant to do without allowing people to "abuse" it. I think it's a nice touch that it can taunt any creature without defender into attacking (and in this day and age, even some creatures WITH defender), but walls remain immune to its nettling insults. NOTE: Mistform Ultimus gets off lucky. If they were ever going to reprint this card, it'd be great if they could use flavour text to allude to the REASON that a creature that cannot attack ends up being destroyed.

Also, another old card that has wings in the art but does not have flying - somewhat counterintuitive. Still very cool, regardless!
